alert.note: Alert for Traill (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 25 at 12:02PM CDT until May 02 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in North Dakota... Goose River at Hillsboro affecting Traill County. .Latest forecast for the Goose River at Hillsboro is for a crest of 16.3 ft late Monday or early Tuesday morning. This is within one-half of a foot of the record crest of 16.75 ft that occurred on April 21, 1979. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Goose River at Hillsboro. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, MAJOR FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
